column4: hi.  when i try using "gdm-stop" to get to the command line, it just gives me a blank screen instead.  i can still type words onto the screen, but they won't function as commands
is there any way to prevent this from happening?
that's not the right place.. ctrl+alt+F2 will get you to a tty.. kinda like a termial.. then issue the command.. ctrl+alt+F7 is where the gui lives.
